00045 void CheckHardDisk(const int diskSpaceNeeded)
00046 {
00047         // Check for enough free disk space on the current disk.
00048         int const drive = _getdrive();
00049         struct _diskfree_t diskfree;
00050 
00051         _getdiskfree(drive, &diskfree);
00052 
00053         unsigned int const neededClusters = 
00054                 diskSpaceNeeded /(diskfree.sectors_per_cluster*diskfree.bytes_per_sector);
00055 
00056         if (diskfree.avail_clusters < neededClusters)
00057         {
00058                 // if you get here you don’t have enough disk space!
00059                 throw GameCodeError(GCERR_INIT_NOT_ENOUGH_DISK_SPACE);
00060         }
00061 }
00062 
00063 
00064 void CheckMemory(const DWORD physicalRAMNeeded, const DWORD virtualRAMNeeded)
00065 {
00066         MEMORYSTATUS status;
00067         GlobalMemoryStatus(&status);
00068         if (status.dwTotalPhys < (physicalRAMNeeded))
00069         {
00070                 // you don’t have enough physical memory. Tell the player to go get a real 
00071                 // computer and give this one to his mother. 
00072                 throw GameCodeError(GCERR_INIT_NOT_ENOUGH_PHYS_RAM);
00073         }
00074 
00075         // Check for enough free memory.
00076         if (status.dwAvailVirtual < virtualRAMNeeded)
00077         {
00078                 // you don’t have enough virtual memory available. 
00079                 // Tell the player to shut down the copy of Visual Studio running in the
00080                 // background, or whatever seems to be sucking the memory dry.
00081                 
00082                 throw GameCodeError(GCERR_INIT_NOT_ENOUGH_VIRT_RAM);
00083         }
00084 
00085         char *buff = GCC_NEW char[virtualRAMNeeded];
00086         if (buff)
00087                 delete[] buff;
00088         else
00089         {
00090                 // The system lied to you. When you attempted to grab a block as big
00091                 // as you need the system failed to do so. Something else is eating 
00092                 // memory in the background; tell them to shut down all other apps 
00093                 // and concentrate on your game.
00094                 
00095                 throw GameCodeError(GCERR_INIT_NOT_ENOUGH_CONTIG_RAM);
00096         }
00097 }

00100 DWORD GetFreeVRAM()
00101 {
00102 /***
00103         // NOTE: This method is deprecated, and unfortunately not really replaced with
00104         // anything useful.....
00105 
00106 
00107         DDSCAPS2 ddsCaps;
00108         ZeroMemory(&ddsCaps, sizeof(ddsCaps));
00109                 
00110         ddsCaps.dwCaps = DDSCAPS_VIDEOMEMORY;
00111         DWORD dwUsedVRAM = 0;
00112         DWORD dwTotal=0;
00113         DWORD dwFree=0;
00114 
00115         // lp_DD points to the IDirectDraw object       
00116         HRESULT hr = g_pDisplay->GetDirectDraw()->GetAvailableVidMem(&ddsCaps, &dwTotal, &dwFree); 
00117                 
00118         // dwUsedVRAM holds the number of bytes of VRAM used
00119         dwUsedVRAM = dwTotal-dwFree;
00120         return dwUsedVRAM;                                                              
00121 ****/
00122         return 0;
00123 }

00128 
00129 GameOptions::GameOptions(const char* path)
00130 {
00131         m_useHardwareAccel = ::GetPrivateProfileIntA( 
00132                 "DISPLAY", "Hardware_Acceleration", false, path ) ? true : false;
00133 
00134         m_usePageFlipping = ::GetPrivateProfileIntA( 
00135                 "DISPLAY", "PageFlip", true, path ) ? true : false;
00136 
00137         m_useDithering = ::GetPrivateProfileIntA( 
00138                 "DISPLAY", "Dithering", true, path ) ? true : false;
00139 
00140         m_useAntialiasing = ::GetPrivateProfileIntA(
00141                 "DISPLAY", "AntiAliasing", true, path ) ? true : false;
00142 
00143         m_useEgdeAntiAliasing = ::GetPrivateProfileIntA( 
00144                 "DISPLAY", "Edge_AntiAliasing", false, path ) ? true : false;
00145 
00146         m_useVRAM = ::GetPrivateProfileIntA(
00147                 "DISPLAY", "Enable_VRAM", true, path ) ? true : false;
00148 
00149         m_runFullSpeed = ::GetPrivateProfileIntA( 
00150                 "DISPLAY", "Fullspeed", false, path ) ? true : false;
00151 
00152         m_useTexturePerspective = ::GetPrivateProfileIntA( 
00153                 "DISPLAY", "Texture_Perspective", true, path ) ? true : false;
00154 
00155         // ================================================================
00156         // new for 2nd Edition!
00157 
00158         m_soundEffectsVolume = ::GetPrivateProfileIntA( 
00159                 "SOUND", "Sound_Effects_Volume", false, path ) / 100.0f;
00160 
00161         m_musicVolume = ::GetPrivateProfileIntA( 
00162                 "SOUND", "Music_Volume", false, path ) / 100.0f;
00163 
00164         m_expectedPlayers = ::GetPrivateProfileIntA( 
00165                 "MULTIPLAYER", "Expected_Players", 2, path );
00166 
00167         m_listenPort = ::GetPrivateProfileIntA( 
00168                 "MULTIPLAYER", "Listen_Port", -1, path );
00169 
00170         char buffer[256];
00171         ::GetPrivateProfileStringA( 
00172                 "MULTIPLAYER", "Game_Host", "", buffer, 256, path );
00173         m_gameHost = buffer;
00174 
00175         m_numAIs = ::GetPrivateProfileIntA( 
00176                 "MULTIPLAYER", "Expected_AIs", 1, path );
00177 }

00182 
00183 bool IsOnlyInstance(LPCTSTR gameTitle)
00184 {
00185         // Find the window.  If active, set and return false
00186         // Only one game instance may have this mutex at a time...
00187 
00188         HANDLE handle = CreateMutex(NULL, TRUE, gameTitle);
00189 
00190         // Does anyone else think 'ERROR_SUCCESS' is a bit of a dichotomy?
00191         if (GetLastError() != ERROR_SUCCESS)
00192         {
00193                 HWND hWnd = FindWindow(gameTitle, NULL);
00194                 if (hWnd) 
00195                 {
00196                         // An instance of your game is already running.
00197                         ShowWindow(hWnd, SW_SHOWNORMAL);
00198                         SetFocus(hWnd);
00199                         SetForegroundWindow(hWnd);
00200                         SetActiveWindow(hWnd);
00201                         return false;
00202                 }
00203         }
00204         return true;
00205 }

00207 //
00208 // GetSaveGameDirectory - Chapter 5 - page 146
00209 // (old name is GetProfilesDirectory)
00210 //
00211 
00212 const TCHAR *GetSaveGameDirectory(HWND hWnd, const TCHAR *gameAppDirectory)
00213 {
00214         HRESULT hr;
00215 
00216         static TCHAR m_ProfilesDirectory[MAX_PATH];
00217         TCHAR userDataPath[MAX_PATH];
00218 
00219         hr = SHGetSpecialFolderPath(hWnd, userDataPath, CSIDL_APPDATA, true);
00220 
00221         _tcscpy(m_ProfilesDirectory, userDataPath);
00222         _tcscat(m_ProfilesDirectory, _T("\\"));
00223         _tcscat(m_ProfilesDirectory, gameAppDirectory);
00224 
00225         // Does our directory exist?
00226         if (0xffffffff == GetFileAttributes(m_ProfilesDirectory))
00227         {
00228                 // Nope - we have to go make a new directory to store application data.
00229                 //
00230                 // Game Coding Complete reference - Chapter 11, page 388
00231                 //
00232                 TCHAR current[MAX_PATH];
00233                 _tcscpy(current, userDataPath);
00234 
00235                 TCHAR myAppData[MAX_PATH];
00236                 _tcscpy(myAppData, gameAppDirectory);
00237 
00238                 TCHAR token[MAX_PATH];
00239                 token[0] = 0;
00240 
00241                 do {
00242                         TCHAR *left = _tcschr(myAppData, '\\');
00243                         if (left==NULL)
00244                         {
00245                                 _tcscpy(token, myAppData);
00246                                 myAppData[0] = 0;
00247                         }
00248                         else
00249                         {
00250                                 _tcsncpy(token, myAppData, left-myAppData);
00251                                 token[left-myAppData] = 0;
00252                                 _tcscpy(myAppData, left+1);
00253                         }
00254 
00255                         if (_tcslen(token))
00256                         {
00257                                 _tcscat(current, _T("\\"));
00258                                 _tcscat(current, token);
00259                                 if (false == CreateDirectory(current, NULL))
00260                                 {
00261                                         int error = GetLastError();
00262                                         if (error != ERROR_ALREADY_EXISTS)
00263                                         {
00264                                                 return false;
00265                                         }
00266                                 }
00267                         }
00268 
00269                 } while (_tcslen(myAppData));
00270         }
00271                 
00272         _tcscat(m_ProfilesDirectory, _T("\\"));
00273         return m_ProfilesDirectory;
00274 }
